The app on your phone needs to respond to commands from the server to delete those messages. Your conversation partner could be running a modified version of the app that ignores these commands. This is a general problem for all messaging apps.

This even goes for Telegram, which stores messages on their servers (a huge red flag, btw). Because a modified version of the app could just copy messages so that theyâ€™re still available after they have been removed from the server.
